src/lib/components/DashCalendarTimeline..description: DashCalendarTimeline renders React's Calendar Timeline inside the Dash App.

id.description: The ID used to identify this component in Dash callbacks.

groups.description: The groups are used to determine the number of groups in a Timeline.

items.description: The items are used to determine the number of items within a single group.

defaultTimeStart.description: This sets the start time for the timeline.

defaultTimeEnd.description: This sets the end time for the timeline.

visibleTimeStart.description: The exact starting viewport of the calendar.

visibleTimeEnd.description: The exact ending viewport of the calendar.

buffer.description: a number (default to 3) which represents the extra timeline rendered on right and lift of the visible area which the user will scroll through before the time rerenders. Note: setting buffer to 1 will disable the scrolling on the timeline.

sidebarWidth.description: Width of the sidebar in pixels. If set to 0, the sidebar is not rendered. Defaults to 150.

rightSidebarWidth.description: Width of the right sidebar in pixels. If set to 0, the right sidebar is not rendered. Defaults to 0.

minResizeWidth.description: The minimum width, in pixels, of a timeline entry when it's possible to resize. If not reached, you must zoom in to resize more. Default to 20.

lineHeight.description: Height of one line in the calendar in pixels. Default 30

itemHeightRatio.description: What percentage of the height of the line is taken by the item? Default 0.65

minZoom.description: Smallest time the calendar can zoom to in milliseconds. Default 60 * 60 * 1000 (1 hour)

maxZoom.description: Largest time the calendar can zoom to in milliseconds. Default 5 * 365.24 * 86400 * 1000 (5 years)

canMove.description: Can items be dragged around? Can be overridden in the items array. Defaults to true

canChangeGroup.description: Can items be moved between groups? Can be overridden in the items array. Defaults to true

canResize.description: Can items be resized? Can be overridden in the items array. Accepted values: false, "left", "right", "both". Defaults to "right". If you pass true, it will be treated as "right" to not break compatibility with versions 0.9 and below.

useResizeHandle.description: Append a special .rct-drag-right handle to the elements and only resize if dragged from there. Defaults to false.

traditionalZoom.description: Zoom in when scrolling the mouse up/down. Defaults to false.

timeSteps.description:
With what step to display different units. E.g. 15 for minute means only minutes 0, 15, 30 and 45 will be shown.
Default:
       {
         second: 1,
         minute: 1,
         hour: 1,
         day: 1,
         month: 1,
         year: 1
       }

customItems.description: This will determine whether you'd want to set up custom content for items or not.

customGroups.description: This will determine whether you'd want to set up custom content for groups or not.

customItemsContent.description: This will be used to set up custom content of items in the main timeline.

selectedItemColor.description: Item color when item is selected.

draggingItemColor.description: Item color while the item is being dragged around.

resizingItemBorder.description: Item border (CSS border e.g, 2px solid red) while the item is being resized.

itemsStyle.description: This will be used to set up custom css styles for content of custom items in the main timeline.

itemsClass.description: This will be used to set up custom css classes for content of custom items in the main timeline.

customGroupsContent.description: This will be used to set up custom content of groups in the sidebar.

groupsStyle.description: This will be used to set up custom css style of content of groups in the sidebar.

groupsClass.description: This will be used to set up custom css classes of content of groups in the sidebar.

dragInfoLabel.description: This will render a info label over the timeline while the item is being dragged around.

sidebarHeaderVariant.description: Determines whether the content goes above the left or right sidebar.

sidebarHeaderContent.description: Renders the Content above the sidebar.

timelineHeaderStyle.description: Style applied to the root component of headers.

dateHeaderStyle.description: Style applied to the root of the header.

dateHeaderUnit.description: Determines the intervals between columns. Values can be second, minute, hour, day, week, month, year or primaryHeader.

dateHeaderLabelFormat.description: Controls the how to format the interval label

dateHeaderHeight.description: Determines the height of the header in pixels. Default 30.

clickData.description: Returns the Item ID and time for the item clicked.

setProps.description:
Dash-assigned callback that should be called to report property changes
to Dash, to make them available for callbacks.
